Exigences: The description of this request is only available in French. | Benevole recherche a titre de comptable (expert-conseil). Le benevole agira a titre d'expert-conseil aupres du conseil d'administration et de la direction afin de soutenir la meilleure gestion de finances et de comptabilite de l'organisme. La personne choisie portera une aide a la direction et a l'adjoint administratif lors de la tenue des bilans de comptabilite et lors de la preparation des etats financiers mensuels pour le CA. Elle aidera aux employes administratifs lors de la reconciliation bancaire ainsi qu'a la preparation des rapports aux gouvernements (deductions a la source, releves d'emploi, declarations annuelles, statut charitable, etc.). La personne benevole fournira des conseils financiers au CA et a la direction sur la mise a jour des meilleures pratiques de comptabilite programmatique tels qu'exiges par les bailleurs de fonds des organismes sans but lucratif au Quebec. Elle conseillera le CA sur la mise a jour et le peaufinage des pratiques de controle et de surveillance de la gestion des comptes, de la petite caisse, des achats par carte de credit et de l'utilisation de la marge de credit. Pour ce qui concerne ce role d'expert-conseil et de surveillance, la personne recrutee sera redevable directement au CA. Suite a ses conseils offerts au CA et des resolutions adoptees par ce dernier, le comptable benevole pourrait etre appele a gerer l'implantation des systemes d'informations comptables ou la modification/mise a jour des systemes deja en place. | Place of work: On location

Exigences: The description of this request is only available in French. | Guides benevoles recherches pour jouer a la fois les roles de guide, d'interprete et d'educateur. Qualites recherchees: etre passionne de l'histoire canadienne et souhaiter partager cet interet avec les autres; comprendre le francais et l'anglais (la formation est generalement donnee en francais, cependant les documents sont disponibles dans les deux langues); vouloir animer de visite guidee avec le public scolaire. Les groupes scolaires du primaire et du secondaire constituent environ 75% de la clientele. Il faut que le benevole soit disponible la semaine, tout particulierement les lundis, car c'est la journee de formation. 	Il faut vouloir travailler en equipe: l'equipe d'animation compte deja plus de 20 guides-benevoles et 10 animateurs. Le benevole sera constamment appele a cooperer efficacement avec plusieurs personnes differentes a la fois. Il faut demontrer de la flexibilite et une aptitude a s'adapter et a travailler efficacement a l'interieur d'une variete de situations et avec des personnes ou de groupes varies. Il faut aussi avoir la capacite physique de monter deux etages en utilisant un escalier et de se tenir debout durant une a deux heures. Dans ce contexte le guide-benevole sera appele a animer des visites pour le public scolaire et adulte et a representer le musee et a bonifier l'experience du visiteur lors d'evenements speciaux. A titre de benevole, il ou elle pourra etre appele a faire du travail administratif pour le service de l'action educative. | Place of work: On location
Mission: Public research and teaching museum dedicated to the preservation, study, diffusion and appreciation of Canadian history.

Length of commitment: Three hours, once a week
Exigences: Volunteers needed to do one-on-one tutoring with students from grades one to six in the organization's after-school program. Many of the students have difficulty with literacy, math and second-language skills and several struggle with learning and behaviour difficulties. Volunteers can help with assigned homework as well as additional review, or they can work with small groups of children who need additional support in a particular subject. Volunteers also support animators in leading a wide variety of educational, creative and physical activities for the children once homework is done. Volunteers in the program act as mentors and role models, and are encouraged to get to know children in order to develop positive relationships with them. Volunteers from all academic backgrounds who are willing to share their time, skills and interests with the students are welcome. | Place of work: On location

Length of commitment: September to June, variable schedule
Organisation: Ile du savoir / Programme Eclairs de sciences
Exigences: Volunteers needed to act as scientific consultants for the Eclair de sciences program, aimed at giving elementary school teachers the materials and structured assistance they need in order to teach science more dynamically and develop their autonomy. Scientific consultants are what gives this program it particularity. During the school year, they assist the teachers in the planning of four scientific activities for their students. During these meetings, their role is to teach the teachers about the scientific method, help them with scientific content and plan the experiment itself. Consultants must hold a bachelor's degree in a scientific discipline and have a basic comprehension of French. The schedule may vary. Volunteers must commit to four meetings a year, on weekdays during the day, from September through June. A mandatory training session takes place one evening (date to be determined). | Place of work: Ecole pres de la residence ou travail du benevole / School close to the volunteer's home or work
Mission: Support for primary school teachers in the field of science, by offering tools and a service of structured help so they can galvanize their teaching of science as well as develop their autonomy.

Activities: Animating activities | Cooking, kitchen assistance | Organization/Coordination | Manual work
Length of commitment: Five hours a month, Monday evenings, for six months
Exigences: Volunteers are needed to help organize the weeky Dinner & Discussion, which draws a crowd of about 20 people every Monday evening. It is intended as a space for members to gather and socialize, to share and learn together. The evening's meal is planned and prepared by a volunteer cook with support from members. Clean-up is done communally, after which members and volunteers gather for a discussion or workshop on a variety of topics presented each week by a guest facilitator. Tasks: plan a healthy, balanced meal, with a vegetarian and meat option, for roughly 20 people, respecting the given budget; liaise with a volunteer driver for the purchase and delivery of ingredients; facilitate member participation in meal preparation; manage cleanliness and contents of kitchen fridge; eat with the group and (optional) stay for the workshop and, if staying for workshop, help tidy the kitchen and dining area after the meal. Requirements: experience/knowledge in HIV/AIDS, sexuality, sexual health an asset, commitment to principles of harm reduction and anti-oppression, experience cooking for groups and ability to work autonomously and in a team. Bilingualism is an asset. Volunteers are expected to complete Volunteer Orientation, which takes place over the course of a weekend, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. Saturday and Sunday. | Place of work: On location
Mission: Volunteer-based community organization working to enhance the quality of life of people living with HIV/AIDS, to prevent HIV transmission, and to promote community awareness and action.
